Key Match Events: Jos Buttler scored 73 off 47 balls to help England overcome New Zealand in a tense showdown.
Alex Hales made 52 off 40 balls for England.
Glenn Phillips scored 62 off 36 balls for New Zealand.
Ben Stokes took a catch to dismiss Finn Allen off Sam Curran's bowling.
Chris Jordan took boundary catches to see off Mitchell and Phillips in the 17th and 18th overs.
Pre-Game Insights: England would have been all-but eliminated with a defeat.
Post-Match Reflections: England breathed fresh life into their T20 World Cup campaign with the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a much-improved display from England after faltering against Ireland.
Jos Buttler was slow out of the gate but had started to cast off the shackles after being joined by Moeen.
Englandâ€™s bowlers were disciplined at the death to close out a 20-run victory.
Others: A semi-final place is far from assured as England still need to beat Sri Lanka on Saturday and hope Australia do not overhaul their net run-rate.
